intro: Gynoxys columbiana, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bright red berries that persist through the winter. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The berries are an important food source for birds and other wildlife.
